column4: ezrafree: the make and model are moot. You need to know the chip inside
how can i find this info out?
thanks i'll try. may take a sec cause i have to switch my wireless keyboard over to that computer to do it, so brb :)
where in this output would it say the chipset?
strange, i have a product: line on the first *-network (my wired adapter) but not on the second one for my usb wifi adapter
yes i have access points (mine and two others in the area) showing up from that command
yes i can see the access point there as well
but if i try to connect to it, it just tries to authenticate and then brings up the Authentication Required window again after awhile
i'm connected to it fine through the windows machine i am using to talk to you now
well the card definitely supports WPA WPA2 Personal, since it's working under that security method in another box
so you're saying ubuntu won't support WPA/WPA2 Personal?
and for some reason i can't figure out what chip this adapter uses... hmm
okay, i'll give it a shot. i really prefer the security of WPA to WEP though
yeah, i know. and i'd buy a better card if i weren't so completely broke right now.
unfortunately i just moved to denver heh
